sen.j: ちらし寿司（ちらしずし）は、寿司の一種である。
sen.e: Chirasizushi is a kind of sushi.
Chirasizushi is a kind of sushi.
Chirasizushi is a kind of sushi.

sen.j: 地域によって特徴が違う。
sen.e: It shows different characteristics in each region.
It has unique characteristics that change according to each region.
It has unique characteristics that change according to each region.

sen.j: また、様々な種類が存在する。
sen.e: And there are many kinds of chirashizushi.
And there are many kinds of chirashizushi.
And there are many kinds of chirashizushi.

sen.j: おおむね日本全国に分布するちらし寿司には、具を乗せるちらし寿司（乗せ寿司）と、具を混ぜ込むもの（混ぜ寿司）あるいは地域によっては混ぜ込んだちらし寿司にさらに刺身・切り身などを乗せるものの二つに大別される。
sen.e: There are largely two kinds in chirashizushi, which is seen in almost every part of Japan - vinegared rice being topped with various kinds of main ingredients (nosezushi; topping type sushi) and main ingredients being mixed with vinegared rice (mixed type), and a combination of both is seen in some region, that is, main ingredients such as sashimi and slices being placed on top of vinegared rice mixed with other ingredients.

There are largely two kinds of chirashizushi, which are seen in almost every part of Japan - vinegared rice being topped with various kinds of main ingredients (nosezushi; topping type sushi) and main ingredients being mixed with vinegared rice (mixed type), and a combination of both is seen in some regions, that is, the main ingredients such as sashimi and slices being placed on top of vinegared rice mixed with other ingredients.

There are largely two kinds of chirashizushi, which are seen in almost every part of Japan - vinegared rice being topped with various kinds of main ingredients (topping type) and main ingredients being mixed with vinegared rice (mixed type), and a combination of both is seen in some regions, that is, the main ingredients such as sashimi and slices of fish being placed on top of vinegared rice mixed with other ingredients.

sen.j: 地域によって異なるが、多くは汁物として吸い物が添えられるが、味噌汁など別の汁物を添える場合もある。
sen.e: Although being different from region to region, suimono (clear soup) or other types of soup such as miso-soup are often served with this type of sushi,
Although different from region to region, suimono (clear soup) or other types of soup such as miso-soup are often served with this type of sushi,
Although different from region to region, suimono (clear soup) or other types of soup such as miso-soup are often served with this type of sushi.
sen.cmt: 文末をピリオドにしました。

sen.j: 「ちらし寿司」という名称では、主に東日本では江戸発祥の、握り寿司のネタ用の刺身などを寿司飯の上に並べた寿司と指し、西日本では生物を使わず、様々な具材を細かく切ったものを酢飯に乗せた寿司あるいは混ぜ込んだ寿司を指す傾向がある。
sen.e: In eastern Japan, the term 'chirashizushi' tends to mean a type of sushi comprising vinegared rice topped with sashimi slices, i.e. ingredients for nigirizushi (sushi shaped by hand) which originated in the Edo period, while it generally means in western Japan a kind of sushi of vinegared rice either mixed with or topped with finely chopped ingredients of various kinds excluding uncooked foods.

In eastern Japan, the term 'chirashizushi' tends to mean a type of sushi comprising of vinegared rice topped with sashimi slices, i.e. ingredients for nigirizushi (sushi shaped by hand) which originated in the Edo period, while it generally refers in western Japan to a kind of sushi that is made of vinegared rice either mixed with or topped with finely chopped ingredients of various kinds excluding raw foods.

In eastern Japan, the term 'chirashizushi' tends to mean a type of sushi comprising of vinegared rice topped with sashimi slices, i.e. ingredients for nigirizushi (sushi shaped by hand) which originated in the Edo period, while it generally refers in western Japan to a kind of sushi that is made of vinegared rice either mixed with or topped with finely chopped ingredients of various kinds excluding raw foods.

sen.j: 寿司の食品素材を販売する広島市の株式会社あじかんによれば、質素倹約を奨励し、庶民の奢侈をたびたび禁じた備前国岡山藩藩主の池田光政が汁物以外に副食を一品に制限する「一汁一菜令」を布告したことが、岡山名物のばらずしが生まれた背景となっていると説明している。
sen.e: AHJIKAN Co. Ltd. of Hiroshima City, who sells foods including sushi ingredients explains that the background to the appearance of barazushi (scattered sushi) which is an Okayama specialty was the issuance of 'Ichiju-issai-rei' (一汁一菜令) which is an order on people against eating more than rice with soup and one other dish by Mitsumasa IKEDA, the lord of Okayama Domain in Bizen Province (the south-eastern part of Okayama Prefecture) who encouraged people to live a modest and frugal life and often prohibited people's extravagance.

AHJIKAN Co. Ltd. of Hiroshima City, who sells foods including sushi ingredients explains the background to the appearance of barazushi (scattered sushi) which is an Okayama specialty was the issuance of 'Ichiju-issai-rei' (一汁一菜令) which was an order against eating more than rice with soup and one other dish by Mitsumasa IKEDA, the lord of Okayama Domain in Bizen Province (the south-eastern part of Okayama Prefecture) who encouraged people to live a modest and frugal life and often prohibited extravagant lifestyles.

AHJIKAN Co. Ltd. of Hiroshima City, who sells food ingredients for sushi, explains the appearance of barazushi (scattered sushi), one of specialities in Okayama, went back to an order issued by Mitsumasa IKEDA, the lord of Okayama Domain in Bizen Province, who encouraged people to live a modest and frugal life and often prohibited extravagant lifestyles, that restricted their daily meals to the one rice bowl with one side dish and one soup.
sen.cmt: 左記のようにしました。

sen.j: 同社は、池田光正の命日である6月27日を「ちらし寿司の日」として日本記念日協会に申請、同協会により2004年4月1日に記念日として登録されている。
sen.e: The company made an application with Japan Anniversary Association for designating June 27, the deathday of Mitsumasa IKEDA, as 'the Day of Chirashizushi', and the Association registered it accordingly on April 1, 2004.

The company made an application with the Japan Anniversary Association to designate June 27, the day of Mitsumasa IKEDA's passing, as 'the Day of Chirashizushi', and the Association registered it accordingly on April 1, 2004.

The company made an application with the Japan Anniversary Association to designate June 27, the day of Mitsumasa IKEDA's passing, as 'the Day of Chirashizushi', and the Association registered it accordingly on April 1, 2004.

tit.j: 具を乗せるちらし寿司

sen.j: 酢飯の上に寿司だねを彩りよく配置して乗せた江戸前寿司店のちらし寿司のほか、鹿児島県の酒寿司・岡山県のばら寿司などがある。
sen.e: The most representative chirashizushi of this type is the one served in Edo-style sushi restaurants which is to top vinegared rice with sushi ingredients making for a pleasing balance of colors, and additionally there are sakezushi of Kagoshima Prefecture, barazushi of Okayama Prefecture and so on.

The most representative chirashizushi of this type is the one served in Edo-style sushi restaurants where vinegared rice is topped with sushi ingredients making for a pleasant balance of colors, and additionally there is sakezushi of Kagoshima Prefecture, barazushi of Okayama Prefecture and so on.

The most representative chirashizushi of this type is the one served in Edo-style sushi restaurants where vinegared rice is topped with sushi ingredients making for a pleasant balance of colors, and additionally there is sakezushi of Kagoshima Prefecture, barazushi of Okayama Prefecture and so on.

sen.j: 江戸が発祥で、東京都をはじめ東日本での「ちらし寿司」。
sen.e: It originated in Edo and spread over Tokyo and other eastern Japan.
It originated in Edo and spread over Tokyo and other parts of eastern Japan.
It originated in Edo and spread over Tokyo and other parts of eastern Japan.

sen.j: 握り寿司用のネタ（魚介類の刺身など）を中心にさまざまな具を飾り乗せして並べたもの寿司飯の上に具を飾り乗せするちらし寿司。
sen.e: Chirashizushi which is made by decoratively placing mainly nigirizushi ingredients (seafood slices, etc) on top of sushimeshi (cooked rice flavored with slightly sweetened vinegar)
Chirashizushi is made by decoratively placing mainly nigirizushi ingredients (seafood slices, etc) on top of sushimeshi (cooked rice flavored with slightly sweetened vinegar)

This type of chirashizushi is decoratively topped with nigirizushi's main ingredients (seafood slices, etc) in the center and various other ingredients on cooked rice flavored with slightly sweetened vinegar.
sen.cmt: オリジナルがわかりにくいので、双方をまとめました。

sen.j: 器に丼鉢を用いたものを海鮮丼とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: This type of chirashizushi is also called kaisen-don (海鮮丼) when it is served in a donburi bowl..
This type of chirashizushi is also called kaisen-don (海鮮丼) when served in a donburi bowl..
This type of chirashizushi is also called seafood bowl (kaisen-don) when served in a donburi bowl.
sen.cmt: 海鮮丼に説明を加えました。

sen.j: 寿司屋や丼物店で出されることが多い。
sen.e: It is often served in sushi restaurants and donburi-mono (single bowl meals) restaurants.
It is often served in sushi restaurants and donburi-mono (single bowl meals) restaurants.
It is often served in sushi restaurants and donburi-mono (single bowl meals) restaurants.

sen.j: 乗せる寿司だねは、マグロ・ネギトロ、ホタテガイ、サケ、イカ、エビ、タコ、イクラ、ウニなどの魚介類と、卵焼き、ガリなど寿司の素材に用いられるものが一般的で、ほかに青シソやキュウリの薄切り、茹でたキヌサヤなどで彩りを添え、ワサビを添えることが多い。
sen.e: Topping ingredients are typically those seafood used for sushi such as tune, negi-toro (the fatty flesh of tuna minced to a paste and mixed with chopped green leaves of Welsh onions), scallop, salmon, squid, shrimps, octopus, salmon roe and sea-urchin eggs, and often served with such color-adding vegetables as green perillas, cucumber slices and boiled snow peas together with wasabi.

Ingredients used for toppings are typically those seafood used for sushi such as tune, negi-toro (the fatty flesh of tuna minced to a paste and mixed with chopped green leaves of Welsh onions), scallop, salmon, squid, shrimps, octopus, salmon roe and sea-urchin eggs, and is often served with such color-adding vegetables as green perillas, cucumber slices and boiled snow peas together with wasabi.

Ingredients used for toppings are typically seafood used for sushi such as tune, negitoro (fatty tuna and leek onion), scallop, salmon, squid, shrimp, octopus, salmon roe and sea-urchin egg, as well as a soy-flavored omelet and vinegared ginger pickles, and often served with such colorful vegetables as green perillas, cucumber slices and boiled snow peas together with wasabi.

sen.j: たねを小皿（おてしょ）にいれた醤油につけながら食べる。
sen.e: When eating, the topping ingredients are dipped in the soy sauce poured in a small plate called otesho.
When eating, the topping ingredients are dipped into soy sauce that is poured in a small plate called otesho.
When eating, the topping ingredients are dipped into soy sauce in a small plate called otesho.

sen.j: 寿司用の醤油を垂らして食べることもある。
sen.e: Sometimes it is eaten with soy sauce dripped on the ingredients.
Sometimes it is eaten with soy sauce that is drizzled on the ingredients.
Sometimes it is eaten with soy sauce poured on the ingredients.

sen.j: 江戸時代の岡山城下が発祥。
sen.e: Originated in the castle town of the Okayama Domain in the Edo period.
Originated in the castle town of the Okayama Domain in the Edo period.
Originated in the castle town of the Okayama Domain in the Edo period.

sen.j: 地域や季節によって内容が変わるが、酢飯の上に錦糸玉子を敷き詰め、その上に椎茸・干瓢の煮しめ、茹でニンジン、酢蓮根、エンドウ、竹輪、蒲鉾、田麩、味を付け高野豆腐、茹でた蛸、殻付の海老、焼穴子、烏賊、蛸、藻貝、鰆、ママカリのさまざまな具材を大きめに切断して（藻貝やエビ、エンドウなどは切らない）敷き詰める。
sen.e: The ingredients change according to seasons and areas, but typically vinegared rice placed in a vessel is covered with kinshi-tamago (thin omelet cut into narrow strips) and chopped ingredients are spread all over it such as shiitake mushrooms and kanpyo (dried strips of the flesh of a kind of gourd) both simmered in a soy broth, boiled carrots, surenkon (lotus root pickled in vinegar), green peas, chikuwa (fish paste cooked in a bamboo-like shape), kamaboko (steamed fish paste), denbu (dried shredded fish seasoned with sugar and soy sauce), seasoned koyadofu (freeze-dried tofu), boiled octopus, shrimp in shell, grilled anago (conger eel), squid, mogai (sarubo ribbed ark), sawara (Japanese Spanish mackerel) and mamakari (Japanese shad), but the ingredients such as mogai, shrimp and green peas are served whole without being chopped.
sen.cmt: 2度目の蛸は焼いたものかどうかが不明であり、「茹でた蛸」との重複の可能性があるので訳してありません。
sen.e: The ingredients change according to seasons and areas, but typically vinegared rice placed in a vessel is covered with kinshi-tamago (a thin omelet cut into narrow strips) and chopped ingredients are spread all over it such as shiitake mushrooms and kanpyo (dried strips of the flesh of a kind of gourd) both simmered in a soy broth, boiled carrots, surenkon (lotus root pickled in vinegar), green peas, chikuwa (fish paste cooked in a bamboo-like shape), kamaboko (steamed fish paste), denbu (dried shredded fish seasoned with sugar and soy sauce), seasoned koyadofu (freeze-dried tofu), boiled octopus, shrimp in shell, grilled anago (conger eel), squid, mogai (sarubo ribbed ark), sawara (Japanese Spanish mackerel) and mamakari (Japanese shad), but the ingredients such as mogai, shrimp and green peas are served whole.

The ingredients varies according to seasons and areas, but typically vinegared rice is covered with kinshi-tamago egg (a thin omelet cut into narrow strips), and on it chopped ingredients are spread over, such as shiitake mushrooms and gourds (both simmered in soy broth), boiled carrots, lotus roots pickled in vinegar, green peas, chikuwa fish paste, kamaboko (steamed fish paste), dried shredded fish seasoning (denbu), seasoned koyadofu (freeze-dried tofu), boiled octopus, shrimp in shell, grilled conger eel, squid, mogai (sarubo ribbed ark), Japanese Spanish mackerel (sawara) and mamakari (Japanese shad), (but the ingredients such as mogai, shrimp and green peas are served whole).

sen.j: 基本的には生ものを使用しない（地域によっては使用する）。
sen.e: Uncooked foods are basically not used (except in some areas).
Uncooked foods are basically not used (except in some areas).
Uncooked foods are basically not used (except in some areas).

sen.j: 大阪などの関西・東日本一帯でも同様の名称の寿司（後述）があるが、乗せる具材の品目数・大きさ・量・盛りつけの豪華さなどが大阪の物よりも圧倒的に多いのが特徴。
sen.e: Sushi having the same name do exist in the Kansai such as Osaka and in the whole eastern Japan area as explained later, but what characterizes Okayama barazushi is that its topping ingredients overwhelmingly excels those of Osaka version in kind, size of each piece, volume and gorgeousness in the way they are displayed.

Sushi having the same name does exist in Kansai such as Osaka and the whole eastern Japan area as explained later, but what characterizes Okayama barazushi is that its topping ingredients overwhelmingly exceeds those of the Osaka version in kind, size of each piece, volume and manner in which they are displayed.

Sushi having the same name does exist in Kansai such as Osaka and the whole eastern Japan area (as explained later), but what characterizes Okayama barazushi is that its topping ingredients overwhelmingly exceeds those of the Osaka version in kind, size of each piece, volume and manner in which they are displayed.
sen.cmt: 後述の部分を（）に入れました。

sen.j: 岡山寿司・備前寿司・祭寿司（正確にはばら寿司弁当の商品名）などとも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called Okayama-zushi, Bizen-zushi and Matsuri-zushi (which are precisely the commercial names of barazushi box lunches).
It is also called Okayama-zushi, Bizen-zushi and Matsuri-zushi (which are the commercial names of barazushi box lunches).
It is also called Okayama-zushi, Bizen-zushi and Matsuri-zushi (which are the commercial names of barazushi box lunches).

tit.j: 具を混ぜるちらし寿司

sen.j: 関西を中心とした西日本での「ちらし寿司」。
sen.e: Chirashizushi' of western Japan centering the Kansai area
Chirashizushi' of western Japan centered on the Kansai area
Chirashizushi' of western Japan centered on the Kansai area

sen.j: 飯に細かく切った魚介類、野菜などの具を混ぜて食べるちらし寿司。
sen.e: It is a kind of chirashizushi made by mixing the finely chopped ingredients such as seafood and vegetables with rice.
It is a kind of chirashizushi made by mixing finely chopped ingredients such as seafood and vegetables with rice.
It is a kind of chirashizushi made by mixing finely chopped ingredients such as seafood and vegetables with rice.

sen.j: 関東などの東日本では五目ちらし・五目すしと呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is called gomokuchirasi or gomokuzushi in eastern Japan such as the Kanto area.
It is called gomokuchirasi or gomokuzushi in eastern Japan such as the Kanto area.
It is called gomokuchirasi or gomokuzushi in eastern Japan such as the Kanto area.

sen.j: ばら寿司（大阪近辺）・ばらちらし（主に関東以外）などとも呼ばれる。
sen.e: This type of sushi is also called barazushi (Osaka and its vicinity) and barachirashi (mainly outside the Kanto area).
This type of sushi is also called barazushi (Osaka and its vicinity) and barachirashi (mainly outside the Kanto area).
This type of sushi is also called barazushi (Osaka and its vicinity) and barachirashi (mainly outside the Kanto area).

sen.j: 酢飯の中に混ぜ込む具として、一般に干し椎茸やかんぴょうの煮しめ、茹でたニンジン、酢レンコンなどをベースに、たとえば桜の花びらの甘酢漬け、タケノコの水煮などで季節感を出すなどの工夫が可能である。
sen.e: The basic ingredients to be mixed with vinegared rice include dried shiitake mushrooms and kanpyo both simmered in a soy broth, boiled carrots and surenkon, and it is possible to make for a sense of the season by adding the ingredients, for example, cherry petals pickled in sweetened vinegar, boiled bamboo shoots, etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The basic ingredients that is mixed with vinegared rice include dried shiitake mushrooms and kanpyo both simmered in a soy broth, boiled carrots and surenkon, and it is possible to make a chirashizushi dish that reflects the seasons, by adding the ingredients, for example, cherry petals pickled in sweetened vinegar, boiled bamboo shoots, etc.

The basic ingredients that is mixed with vinegared rice include dried shiitake mushrooms and gourd (both simmered in a soy broth), boiled carrots and lotus roots pickled in vinegar, and it is possible to make a chirashizushi dish that reflects the season by adding ingredients such as cherry petals pickled in sweetened vinegar or boiled bamboo shoots, etc.

sen.j: さらに竹輪や蒲鉾、田麩、油揚げの煮つけ、味を付けた高野豆腐、茹でた蛸・海老、焼マアナゴ、烏賊の煮付けなどさまざま。
sen.e: There is a wide range of other additional ingredients, like chikuwa, kamaboko, denbu, cooked deep-fried tofu, seasoned koya-dofu, boiled octopus, shrimp, grilled conger eel and cooked squid.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処マアナゴは一般的にアナゴとして流通している3種類の魚の一つとのことで、特に訳し分けの必要はないと判断しました。
sen.e: There is a wide range of other additional ingredients, like chikuwa, kamaboko, denbu, cooked deep-fried tofu, seasoned koya-dofu, boiled octopus, shrimp, grilled conger eel and cooked squid.

There is a wide range of other additional ingredients, like chikuwa fish paste, kamaboko (steamed fish paste), dried shredded fish seasoning (denbu), cooked deep-fried tofu, seasoned koyadofu (freeze-dried tofu), boiled octopus and shrimps, grilled conger eel and cooked squid.

sen.j: これに茹でた絹莢・インゲンで青い彩りを加えるなど、地域・家庭ごとに多様な具が用いられる。
sen.e: Further, the color of green is added by boiled snow peas and string green beans depending on each area and household.
Further, the color green is added through the addition of boiled snow peas and string green beans depending on the area and household.
Further, the color green is added through the addition of boiled snow peas and string green beans depending on the area and household.

sen.j: 具を混ぜ込んだのち、錦糸玉子や刻み海苔、ガリまたは紅しょうが、イクラなどをあしらう。
sen.e: The rice mixed with all the ingredients is topped with kinshi-tamago, dried nori shreds, shredded ginger pickled in sweetened vinegar or red pickled ginger, salmon roe, etc.
The rice mixed with all the ingredients is topped with kinshi-tamago, dried nori shreds, shredded ginger pickled in sweetened vinegar or red pickled ginger, salmon roe, etc.
The rice mixed with all the ingredients is topped with kinshi-tamago egg strips, shredded nori, vinegared ginger pickles or red pickled ginger, salmon roe, etc.

sen.j: 前述の岡山城下発祥のばら寿司の元となった、備前福岡 (瀬戸内市)発祥の「どどめせ」という寿司が発祥とされる。
sen.e: A kind of sushi called 'dodomese' of Fukuoka (Setouchi City) of Bizen Province is said to be the very origin of this type of sushi including the above-mentioned Okayama barazushi which started in the castle town of Okayama.

A kind of sushi called 'dodomese' of Fukuoka (Setouchi City) of Bizen Province is said to be the very origin of this type of sushi including the above-mentioned Okayama barazushi which started in the castle town of Okayama.

A kind of sushi called 'dodomese' of Fukuoka of Bizen Province (Setouchi City) is said to be the very origin of this type of sushi including the above-mentioned Okayama barazushi which started in the castle town of Okayama.
sen.cmt: 瀬戸内市の位置を変更しました。

sen.j: 市販されている「ちらし寿司の素」は、具を混ぜるちらし寿司をつくる基本的素材で、白飯に混ぜるだけで基本的なちらし寿司ができ、これにキヌサヤやインゲン、錦糸玉子、刻み海苔などを加えれば一般的なばらちらしが容易に作れる。
sen.e: The commercially available 'Chirashizushi-no-moto' (chirashizushi mix) is a basic product to make a common type of barachirashi easily by mixing it with cooked rice and other ingredients such as snow peas, string green beans, kinshi-tamago and dried nori shreds.

The commercially available 'Chirashizushi-no-moto' (chirashizushi mix) is a basic product that allows one to make barachirashi easily by mixing it with cooked rice and other ingredients such as snow peas, string green beans, kinshi-tamago and dried nori shreds.

The commercially available 'Chirashizushi-no-moto' (chirashizushi mix) is a basic packeage of ingredients that allows one to make barachirashi easily by mixing them with cooked rice and other ingredients such as snow peas, string green beans, kinshi-tamago egg strips and shredded nori.

sen.j: 具として調理済みのニンジン、レンコン、シイタケ、タケノコ、カンピョウなどと調味料を混ぜたレトルト食品として広く流通している。
sen.e: It is widely distributed as a retort-pouch food item containing such ingredients as cooked carrots, lotus roots, shiitake mushrooms, bamboo shoots and kanpyo with an added blend of seasonings.
It is widely distributed as a retort-pouch food item containing such ingredients as cooked carrots, lotus roots, shiitake mushrooms, bamboo shoots and kanpyo with an added blend of seasonings.
It is widely distributed as a retort-pouch food item containing seasoned ingredients such as cooked carrots, lotus roots, shiitake mushrooms, bamboo shoots and gourd.

sen.j: 具の工夫次第で容易、かつ手軽に作れるため家庭でも作られ、雛祭りなどのごちそう、あるいは祭などハレとケの日の手作り料理として親しまれている。
sen.e: Working out ideas on ingredients, one can make chirashizushi easily and conveniently at home, and because of this it has become a popular family dish prepared at ordinary times and on special occasions such as Hinamatsuri (Girl's Festival held on March 3) and various other festivals.

With a little imagination concerning ingredients, one can make chirashizushi easily and conveniently at home, and because of this it has become a popular family dish prepared during ordinary times and on special occasions such as Hinamatsuri (Girl's Festival held on March 3) and various other festivals.

With a little imagination concerning ingredients, one can make chirashizushi easily and conveniently at home, and because of this it has become a popular family dish prepared during ordinary times and on special occasions such as Hinamatsuri (Girl's Festival held on March 3) and various other festivals.

sen.j: なお、前述の岡山のばら寿司にも、地域によっては具材を混ぜ込む物も存在する。
sen.e: Incidentally, the barazushi of Okayama mentioned earlier has a type which mixes up rice and ingredients depending on the area.
Incidentally, there is also a type of barazushi from Okayama, mentioned earlier, that involves mixing rice and ingredients native to the area.
Incidentally, among the earlier-mentioned barazushi in Okayama, there is also a type with ingredients mixed in rice in some areas.
sen.cmt: 左記のように変更しました。

sen.j: また、混ぜ込んだ物の上から具材をさらに乗せるタイプもある。
sen.e: Also, there is a type in which some additional ingredients are placed on top of the mixed barazushi.
Also, there is a type where additional ingredients are placed on top of the mixed barazushi.
Also, there is a type where additional ingredients are placed on top of the mixed barazushi.

sen.j: 上記以外に、三重県の手こね寿司などのように、具を混ぜ、さらに切り身を乗せるものもある。
sen.e: In addition to those mentioned above, there is a type of chirashizushi, such as tekonezushi of Mie Prefecture, in which rice is mixed with ingredients and topped with sashimi slices.
sen.cmt: 手こね寿司（切り身はマグロあるいはカツオ）の例があるので「切り身」はあくまでも鮮魚の切り身と解釈しています。
sen.e: In addition to those mentioned above, there is a type of chirashizushi, such as tekonezushi of Mie Prefecture, in which rice is mixed with ingredients and topped with sashimi slices.
In addition to those mentioned above, there is a type of chirashizushi, such as tekonezushi of Mie Prefecture, in which rice is mixed with ingredients and topped with sashimi slices.

sen.j: さらに、リンゴ、ミカン、サクランボなどの果物を入れる地域もある。
sen.e: Further, there are some regions where fruits such as apples, tangerines and cherries are mixed in chirashizushi.
Further, there are some regions where fruits such as apples, tangerines and cherries are mixed in chirashizushi.
Further, there are some regions where fruits such as apples, tangerines and cherries are mixed in chirashizushi.
